remarks.format:
## Remarks 类将 XML 数据写入流、文件、文本读取器或字符串。The class writes XML data to a stream, file, text reader, or string. 它支持 W3C[可扩展标记语言（xml）1.0 （第四版）](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)和[XML 1.0 （第三版）建议中的命名空间](https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/)。It supports the W3C [Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 (fourth edition)](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/) and [Namespaces in XML 1.0 (third edition)](https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/) recommendations. 使用 类的成员可以：The members of the class enable you to: - 检查字符是不是合法的 XML 字符，元素和属性的名称是不是有效的 XML 名称。Verify that the characters are legal XML characters and that element and attribute names are valid XML names. - 检查 XML 文档的格式是否正确。Verify that the XML document is well-formed. - 将二进制字节编码为 Base64 或 BinHex，并写出结果文本。Encode binary bytes as Base64 or BinHex, and write out the resulting text. - 使用公共语言运行时类型而不是字符串传递值，以避免必须手动执行值转换。Pass values by using common language runtime types instead of strings, to avoid having to manually perform value conversions. - 将多个文档写入一个输出流。Write multiple documents to one output stream. - 写出有效的名称、限定名和名称标记。Write valid names, qualified names, and name tokens. 本节内容：In this section: [创建 XML 编写器](#create) [Creating an XML writer](#create) [指定输出格式](#output) [Specifying the output format](#output) [数据一致性](#conformance) [Data conformance](#conformance) [编写元素](#writing_elements) [Writing elements](#writing_elements) [编写属性](#writing_attributes) [Writing attributes](#writing_attributes) [处理命名空间](#handling_ns) [Handling namespaces](#handling_ns) [写入类型化数据](#writing_types) [Writing typed data](#writing_types) [关闭 XML 编写器](#close) [Closing the XML writer](#close) [异步编程](#async) [Asynchronous programming](#async) [安全注意事项Security considerations](#security) ## 创建 XML 编写器Creating an XML writer 若要创建 实例，请使用 方法。To create an instance, use the method. 若要指定要在 XML 编写器上启用的功能集，请向 方法传递 。To specify the set of features you want to enable on the XML writer, pass an to the method. 否则，将使用默认设置。Otherwise, default settings are used. 有关详细信息，请参阅 参考页。See the reference pages for details. ## 指定输出格式Specifying the output format 类包含若干属性，这些属性控制 输出的格式：The class includes several properties that control how output is formatted: |属性Property|说明Description| |--------------|-----------------| ||指定要使用的文本编码。Specifies the text encoding to use. 默认为 `Encoding.UTF8`。The default is `Encoding.UTF8`.| ||指示是否使元素缩进。Indicates whether to indent elements. 默认值为 `false` （无缩进）。The default is `false` (no indentation).| ||指定在缩进时要使用的字符串。Specifies the character string to use when indenting. 默认值为两个空格。The default is two spaces.| ||指定分行符要使用的字符串。Specifies the character string to use for line breaks. 默认值为 `\r\n`（回车符、换行符）。The default is `\r\n` (carriage return, line feed).| ||指定如何处理换行符。Specifies how to handle newline characters.| ||指示是否在新行上编写属性。Indicates whether to write attributes on a new line. 使用此属性时，应将 设置为 `true`。 should be set to `true` when using this property. 默认为 `false`。The default is `false`.| ||指示是否编写 XML 声明。Indicates whether to write an XML declaration. 默认为 `false`。The default is `false`.| 和 属性控制无效空白如何格式化。The and properties control how insignificant white space is formatted. 例如，若要缩进元素节点：For example, to indent element nodes: [!code-csharp[XmlWriter_v2#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlWriter_v2/CS/writer_v2.cs#8)] [!code-vb[XmlWriter_v2#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlWriter_v2/VB/writer_v2.vb#8)] 使用 用一种额外的缩进级别来编写新行上的每个属性：Use the to write each attribute on a new line with one extra level of indentation: [!code-csharp[XmlWriter_v2#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlWriter_v2/CS/writer_v2.cs#9)] [!code-vb[XmlWriter_v2#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlWriter_v2/VB/writer_v2.vb#9)] ## 数据一致性Data conformance XML 编写器使用 类中的两个属性来检查数据一致性：An XML writer uses two properties from the class to check for data conformance: - 属性指示 XML 编写器检查字符，如果任何字符在合法范围之外时引发 异常，如 W3C 所定义。The property instructs the XML writer to check characters and throw an exception if any characters are outside the legal range, as defined by the W3C. - 属性将 XML 编写器配置为检查写入的流是否符合由 W3C 定义的格式正确的 XML 1.0 文档或文档片段的规则。The property configures the XML writer to check that the stream being written complies with the rules for a well-formed XML 1.0 document or document fragment, as defined by the W3C. 下表介绍了这三个一致性级别。The three conformance levels are described in the following table. 默认为 。The default is . 有关详细信息，请参阅 属性和 枚举。For details, see the property and the enumeration. |LevelLevel|说明Description| |-----------|-----------------| ||XML 输出符合格式正确的 XML 1.0 文档的规则，并可由任何符合要求的处理器处理。The XML output conforms to the rules for a well-formed XML 1.0 document and can be processed by any conforming processor.| ||XML 输出符合格式正确的 XML 1.0 文档片段的规则。The XML output conforms to the rules for a well-formed XML 1.0 document fragment.| ||XML 编写器根据传入数据确定要应用的聘约确认检查的级别（文档或片段）。The XML writer determines which level of conformation checking to apply (document or fragment) based on the incoming data.| ## 编写元素Writing elements 您可以使用以下 方法来写入元素节点。You can use the following methods to write element nodes. 有关示例，请参阅列出的方法。For examples, see the methods listed. |使用Use|至To| |---------|--------| ||写入整个元素节点，包括字符串值。Write an entire element node, including a string value.| ||通过使用多个方法调用来写入元素值。To write an element value by using multiple method calls. 例如，可以调用 来编写类型化的值，调用 来编写字符实体，调用 来编写属性，也可以编写子元素。For example, you can call to write a typed value, to write a character entity, to write an attribute, or you can write a child element. 这是 方法的更复杂的版本。This is a more sophisticated version of the method.

若要关闭元素，请调用 或 方法。To close the element, you call the or method.| ||复制在 或 对象当前位置找到的元素节点。To copy an element node found at the current position of an or object. 在调用时，会将源对象中的所有内容复制到 实例。When called, it copies everything from the source object to the instance.| ## 编写属性Writing attributes 您可以使用以下 方法来写入元素节点上的属性。You can use the following methods to write attributes on element nodes. 这些方法还可用于在元素上创建命名空间声明，如下一部分中所述。These methods can also be used to create namespace declarations on an element, as discussed in the next section. |使用Use|至To| |---------|--------| ||写入整个属性节点，包括字符串值。To write an entire attribute node, including a string value.| ||使用多个方法调用编写特性值。To write the attribute value using multiple method calls. 例如，可以调用 来编写类型化值。For example, you can call to write a typed value. 这是 方法的更复杂的版本。This is a more sophisticated version of the method.

若要关闭元素，请调用 方法。To close the element, you call the method.| ||复制 对象当前位置找到的所有属性。To copy all the attributes found at the current position of an object. 写入的属性取决于读取器当前所处节点的类型：The attributes that are written depend on the type of node the reader is currently positioned on:

-对于特性节点，它将写入当前特性，然后写入特性的其余部分，直到元素结束标记为止。- For an attribute node, it writes the current attribute, and then the rest of the attributes until the element closing tag.
-对于元素节点，它将写入元素包含的所有属性。- For an element node, it writes all attributes contained by the element.
-对于 XML 声明节点，它将写入声明中的所有属性。- For an XML declaration node, it writes all the attributes in the declaration.
-对于所有其他节点类型，该方法将引发异常。- For all other node types, the method throws an exception.| ## 处理命名空间Handling namespaces 命名空间用于限定 XML 文档中的元素和属性的名称。Namespaces are used to qualify element and attribute names in an XML document. 命名空间前缀将元素和属性与命名空间关联，后者又与 URI 引用关联。Namespace prefixes associate elements and attributes with namespaces, which are in turn associated with URI references. 命名空间在 XML 文档中实现元素和属性名称的唯一性。Namespaces create element and attribute name uniqueness in an XML document. 维护与当前命名空间范围中定义的所有命名空间对应的命名空间堆栈。The maintains a namespace stack that corresponds to all the namespaces defined in the current namespace scope. 在编写元素和属性时，可以通过下列方式利用命名空间：When writing elements and attributes you can utilize namespaces in the following ways: - 使用 方法手动声明命名空间。Declare namespaces manually by using the method. 如果知道如何最大程度地优化命名空间声明的数目，可以使用此方法。This can be useful when you know how to best optimize the number of namespace declarations. 有关示例，请参阅 方法。For an example, see the method. - 用新的命名空间重写当前命名空间声明。Override the current namespace declaration with a new namespace. 在下面的代码中， 方法将 `"x"` 前缀的命名空间 URI 从 `"123"` 更改为 `"abc"`。In the following code, the method changes the namespace URI for the `"x"` prefix from `"123"` to `"abc"`. [!code-csharp[XmlWriter_v2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlWriter_v2/CS/writer_v2.cs#18)] [!code-vb[XmlWriter_v2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlWriter_v2/VB/writer_v2.vb#18)] 代码生成以下 XML 字符串：The code generates the following XML string: ```xml ``` - 在编写属性或元素时指定命名空间前缀。Specify a namespace prefix when writing attributes or elements. 许多用于写入元素和属性的方法使您能够执行此操作。Many of the methods used to write element and attributes enable you to do this. 例如， 方法写入开始标记并将其与指定的命名空间和前缀关联。For example, the method writes a start tag and associates it with a specified namespace and prefix. ## 写入类型化数据Writing typed data 方法接受公共语言运行时（CLR）对象，根据 XML 架构定义语言（XSD）数据类型转换规则将输入值转换为其字符串表示形式，并通过使用 方法将其写入。The method accepts a common language runtime (CLR) object, converts the input value to its string representation according to XML schema definition language (XSD) data type conversion rules, and writes it out by using the method. 这比使用 类中的方法在写出类型化数据之前将其转换为字符串值更容易。This is easier than using the methods in the class to convert the typed data to a string value before writing it out. 写入文本时，键入的值将通过使用该架构类型的 规则序列化为文本。When writing to text, the typed value is serialized to text by using the rules for that schema type. 有关对应于 CLR 类型的默认 XSD 数据类型，请参阅 方法。For default XSD data types that correspond to CLR types, see the method. 还可用于写入到 XML 数据存储区。The can also be used to write to an XML data store. 例如， 类可以创建一个 对象，用于为 对象创建节点。For example, the class can create an object to create nodes for an object. 如果数据存储具有可供其使用的架构信息，则如果尝试转换为不允许的类型， 方法将引发异常。If the data store has schema information available to it, the method throws an exception if you try to convert to a type that is not allowed. 如果数据存储没有可用的架构信息， 方法会将所有值视为 `xsd:anySimpleType` 类型。If the data store does not have schema information available to it, the method treats all values as an `xsd:anySimpleType` type. ## 关闭 XML 编写器Closing the XML writer 使用 方法输出 XML 时，在调用 方法之前，不会写入元素和特性。When you use methods to output XML, the elements and attributes are not written until you call the method. 例如，如果使用 填充 对象，则在关闭 实例之前，将无法在目标文档中看到已写入的元素和属性。For example, if you are using to populate an object, you won't be able to see the written elements and attributes in the target document until you close the instance. ## 异步编程Asynchronous programming 大多数 方法的方法名称末尾都有 "Async"。Most of the methods have asynchronous counterparts that have "Async" at the end of their method names. 例如， 的异步等效项。For example, the asynchronous equivalent of is . 对于不包含异步对应的 方法，请将返回值转换为字符串并改用 方法。For the method, which doesn't have an asynchronous counterpart, convert the return value to a string and use the method instead. ## 安全注意事项Security considerations 使用 类时，请注意以下事项：Consider the following when working with the class: - 引发的异常可能会泄露您不希望冒泡到应用程序的路径信息。Exceptions thrown by the can disclose path information that you do not want bubbled up to the app. 应用必须捕获异常并对其进行相应处理。Your app must catch exceptions and process them appropriately. - 不会验证传递到 或 方法的任何数据。 does not validate any data that is passed to the or method. 不应将任意数据传递给这些方法。You should not pass arbitrary data to these methods. ## Examples 下面的示例代码演示如何使用异步 API 来生成 XML。The following example code shows how to use the asynchronous API to generate XML. ```csharp async Task TestWriter(Stream stream) { XmlWriterSettings settings = new XmlWriterSettings(); settings.Async = true; using (XmlWriter writer = XmlWriter.Create(stream, settings)) { await writer.WriteStartElementAsync("pf", "root", "http://ns"); await writer.WriteStartElementAsync(null, "sub", null); await writer.WriteAttributeStringAsync(null, "att", null, "val"); await writer.WriteStringAsync("text"); await writer.WriteEndElementAsync(); await writer.WriteProcessingInstructionAsync("pName", "pValue"); await writer.WriteCommentAsync("cValue"); await writer.WriteCDataAsync("cdata value"); await writer.WriteEndElementAsync(); await writer.FlushAsync(); } } ```

重新使用 对象以创建多个编写器对象。Reuse the object to create multiple writer objects. 将为每个创建的写入器复制 对象并标记为只读。The object is copied and marked read-only for each created writer. 更改 实例上的设置不会影响具有相同设置的现有写入器。Changes to the settings on an instance do not affect existing writers with the same settings. 因此，可以使用相同的设置创建多个具有相同功能的写入器。Thus, you can use the same settings to create multiple writers with the same functionality. 也可以修改 实例上的设置并创建具有不同功能集的新写入器。Or, you can modify the settings on an instance and create a new writer with a different set of features. - 向现有的 XML 编写器添加功能。Add features to an existing XML writer. 方法可以接受其他 对象。The method can accept another object. 基础 对象不必是静态 方法创建的 XML 编写器。The underlying object does not have to be an XML writer created by the static method. 例如，你可以指定用户定义的 XML 编写器来向添加附加功能。For example, you can specify a user-defined XML writer to add additional features to. - remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法仅适用于使用 UTF-16 编码的系统。This method is only applicable on systems that use UTF-16 encoding. 代理项字符实体是以十六进制格式编写的。The surrogate character entity is written in hexadecimal format. 代理项字符的范围 #x10000 为 #x10FFFF。The range for surrogate characters is #x10000 to #x10FFFF. 以下公式用于生成代理项字符实体：（`highChar` 0xD800） \* 0x400 + （`lowChar`-0xDC00） + 0x10000The following formula is used to generate the surrogate character entity: (`highChar` -0xD800) \* 0x400 + (`lowChar` -0xDC00) + 0x10000 对于 HTML 和 XML，文档字符集（以及数字字符引用的表示法）基于 UCS [ISO-10646]。For both HTML and XML, the document character set (and therefore the notation of numeric character references) is based on UCS [ISO-10646]. 因此，在某些情况下，源文档中的单个数字字符引用可与字符串中的 2 16 位单元（高代理项和低代理项）相对应。A single numeric character reference in a source document may therefore in some cases correspond to two 16-bit units in a string (a high surrogate and a low surrogate). 这些16位单元称为代理项对。These 16-bit units are referred to as a surrogate pair. 有关代理项或字符的详细信息，请参阅位于 或[W3C XML 1.0 建议的第2.2 节](https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml#charsets)中的 Unicode 3.0/unicode 2.0 标准的3.7 节。For more information regarding surrogates or characters, refer to section 3.7 of the Unicode 3.0/Unicode 2.0 standard located at , or [section 2.2 of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation](https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml#charsets). 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .
